holidays.name: World Food Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating food and raising awareness about global hunger and food security issues.
holidays.origin: Established by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations in 1979, marking the founding of the FAO on October 16, 1945.
holidays.funFact: World Food Day sometimes features giant food feasts and challenges to raise awareness about wasting food around the world!

holidays.name: National Boss's Day (USA)
holidays.description: A quirky day for employees to recognize and appreciate their bosses (or cleverly survive them).
holidays.origin: Started in 1958 by Patricia Bays Haroski, who registered the day with the U.S. Chamber of Commerce to honor her boss and father.
holidays.funFact: Some employees give gag gifts or humorous cards, making it a hilarious mix of sincerity and satire!

holidays.name: Dictionary Day
holidays.description: Celebrating the publication of the first American English dictionary by Noah Webster, encouraging people to appreciate words.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the birthday of Noah Webster (born October 16, 1758) and the legacy of his dictionary.
holidays.funFact: Noah Webster's dictionary originally included some quite peculiar spellings that he championed, like 'color' instead of 'colour.'

holidays.name: Global Cat Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate our whiskered friends and raise awareness for their welfare worldwide.
holidays.origin: An international celebration created by animal lovers to spotlight the importance of cats in our lives.
holidays.funFact: Global Cat Day inspires many people to attempt fun cat costumes or share memes – cat videos skyrocket in popularity on this day!

holidays.name: Lego Day
holidays.description: A playful day honoring the iconic LEGO brick and encouraging creative building fun.
holidays.origin: Celebrated on the birthday of the LEGO Group, founded on October 16, 1932, in Denmark.
holidays.funFact: The LEGO brick design from 1958 is so brilliant that bricks from that year still interlock perfectly with today's LEGO pieces!
